const buttons = [
  { id: 0, name: "chows", active: true },
  { id: 1, name: "pungs", active: true },
  { id: 2, name: "kongs", active: true },
  { id: 3, name: "honors", active: true },
  { id: 4, name: "other", active: true },
  { id: 5, name: "events", active: true },
];

class Guide extends Component {
  constructor(props) {
    super(props);
    this.state = {
      buttons: buttons,
      fanA: fans,
      count: fans.length,
    };
  }

  // // filter by type of fan
  handleToggle = (id) => {
    let updatedFan = [];
    let missingFan = [];
    const updatedButtons = this.state.buttons.map((button) => {
      if (button.id === id) {
        if (button.active === true) {
          missingFan = fans.filter((f) => f.type.includes(button.name));
          updatedFan = this.state.fanA.filter(
            (x) => missingFan.indexOf(x) === -1
          );
          return {
            ...button,
            active: !button.active,
          };
        } else {
          missingFan = fans.filter((f) => f.type.includes(button.name));
          const tempFan = this.state.fanA
            .concat(missingFan)
            .sort((a, b) => a.name.localeCompare(b.name));
          updatedFan = [...new Set(tempFan)];
          return {
            ...button,
            active: !button.active,
          };
        }
      } else {
        return button;
      }
    });
    this.setState({
      buttons: updatedButtons,
      fanA: updatedFan,
      count: updatedFan.length,
    });
  };

  render() {
    console.log(this.state.fanA);
    return (
      <div>
        <header>
          <Navbar />
        </header>
        <body className="mBody">
          <h1>Fan Guide</h1>
          <h3>
            There are 81 different fan, or collections of sets, that can give
            you points. Possible examples of each hand are shown below. Tiles
            with ellipses indicate an inferrable span of tiles. Blank tiles
            indicate a free space for any tile.
          </h3>
          <p>
            Use the buttons below to filter which fan are visible. Filters apply
            only when they are always implied.
          </p>
          {this.state.buttons.map((el) => (
            <button
              key={el.id}
              onClick={() => this.handleToggle(el.id)}
              className={el.active ? "pillButton" : "pillButtonDe"}
            >
              {el.name}
            </button>
          ))}
          <h4 className="htext">{this.state.count} Fan</h4>
          <div className="faq1">
            {this.state.fanA.map((a) => (
              <Fan
                key={a.name}
                name={a.name}
                description={a.description}
                points={a.points}
                tiles={a.tiles}
                exclusions={a.exclusions}
              />
            ))}
          </div>
        </body>
      </div>
    );
  }
}

export default Guide;
